I need some help with rust specifically in fPIC code. I have a problem that when I build a PIC binary it always puts a GOT in it (and resolves it while compiling !!) and then all the calls to the functions that use GOT will be absolute (which is not good because the code should be PIC and it causes a crash)

My code is in a no std environment but I use compiler builtins like memcpy (which goes into GOT which should not be)

The closest thing I found to my problem is this:
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/57664235/why-does-a-fully-static-rust-elf-binary-have-a-global-offset-table-got-section
Asaf Fisher has marked this topic as resolved.
